conversation.message: School_C is my undeniable first choice, and I am eager to formally apply immediately. I am confident I possess the qualities you seek in your incoming class.
conversation.thought: My goal is to secure a match with my highest possible preferred school. My top choice is School_C. School_C ranks me 4th out of 5 students. However, the three students ranked above me (B, A, D) all prefer School_E first and are highly ranked there (School_E ranks me 1st, B 2nd, A 3rd, D 4th). It is highly probable that B, A, and D will apply to School_E in Round 1. If they apply to School_E, School_C will receive only my application (assuming Student_C applies elsewhere, likely School_D). Therefore, applying immediately to my top choice, School_C, offers a high chance of immediate acceptance in Round 1, capitalizing on the distribution of preferences among the top-ranked students.
